block.p: Christina Marie Montgoris, a daughter of Margaret and William Montgoris of Franklin Lakes, N.J., was married yesterday to Paul Andrew Danforth, the son of Byon and Linda Danforth of Cortlandt Manor, N.Y. The Rev. William Gallagher, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of the Snows in Woodstock, Vt.

Mrs. Danforth, 26, teaches first grade at the Manhattan New School. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in early childhood and elementary education from New York University. Her father retired as the chief operating officer of Bear, Stearns & Company in Manhattan.

Christina Marie Montgoris, a daughter of Margaret and William Montgoris of Franklin Lakes, N.J., was married yesterday to Paul Andrew Danforth, the son of Byon and Linda Danforth of Cortlandt Manor, N.Y. The Rev. William Gallagher, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of the Snows in Woodstock, Vt.

Mrs. Danforth, 26, teaches first grade at the Manhattan New School. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in early childhood and elementary education from New York University. Her father retired as the chief operating officer of Bear, Stearns & Company in Manhattan.

Mr. Danforth, 29, is the director of corporate sales for the New York Mets in Flushing, Queens. He graduated from Hartwick College. His father is a sales manager for Martin Walshin Inc., a heating and cooling system supply distributor in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y.
